snippet: “The Phantom of the Opera” will have its 10,000th Broadway performance on Saturday, thanks to persistent marketing, quality control and smart pricing.
abstract: Musical juggernaut The Phantom of the Opera marks its 10,000th Broadway performance, thanks to persistent marketing, quality control and smart pricing; the $8-million production has earned $845 million since its opening in 1988, and has come to define the modern Broadway musical by proving the purchasing power of women and tourists, the durability of repeat business and the lure of spectacle.

headline.main: A Hit That Has Outlasted 10,000 Chandeliers
headline.print_headline: A Hit That Has Outlasted 10,000 Chandeliers

snippet: Michelle Obama is on the road, campaigning for the president and telling Americans to eat their vegetables.
abstract: First Lady Michelle Obama's tireless and cheerful three-day, four-state tour to mark the second anniversary of her childhood anti-obesity campaign is a timely reminder of why Pres Obama's re-election campaign views her as such a potential weapon.

headline.main: Helpings of Energy and Cheer for the Trail
headline.print_headline: Helpings Of Energy And Cheer For the Trail

snippet: Research in Motion can't catch a break. Joining the large crop of businesses and organizations ditching the BlackBerry, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration said it planned to provide employees with Apple's iPhones and iPads.
abstract: Research in Motion can't catch a break. Joining the large crop of businesses and organizations ditching the BlackBerry, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration said it planned to provide employees with Apple's iPhones and iPads.

headline.main: Scientific Agency to Drop BlackBerry for iPhone
headline.print_headline: BlackBerry Loses Another Big Client To the iPhone

snippet: Google is moving into hardware by developing an "entertainment device" to compete with Amazon and Apple, people with knowledge of the company's plans say, furthering a goal of Larry Page, the chief executive.
abstract: Google is moving into hardware by developing an "entertainment device" to compete with Amazon and Apple, people with knowledge of the company's plans say, furthering a goal of Larry Page, the chief executive.

snippet: Google is at work on a home entertainment device, report David Streitfeld and Nicole Perlroth on Friday in The New York Times. The device, a prototype, will eventually be sold under the Google brand, and is the company's most significant push into...
abstract: Google is at work on a home entertainment device, report David Streitfeld and Nicole Perlroth on Friday in The New York Times. The device, a prototype, will eventually be sold under the Google brand, and is the company's most significant push into hardware. The initial purpose of the device will be for streaming music, but eventually its use could be much wider.

headline.main: Daily Report: An Entertainment Device From Google
